page.title: 17HIGH CROSS SCHOOL FETE.
page.content: The annual summer fete took place on Sunday 23rd June. The weather was dry and sunny. The fete started with lively music played by the Ware Brass Band. There was a total of 38 stalls, including "lucky-dip", "white- elephant", "coconut-shy", "tombola", "bingo", etc. In addition, there were delicious cakes and ice-creams for sale and it was possible to have pony rides and have your face painted!. St. John's church was open, and was colourfully decorated with flowers, and the St. John's Ambulance service were on hand, in case of emergencies. The fete opened at 2-30pm and cost 20p to enter. It took place on the village school field, and refreshments were available in the school itself. It was an enjoyable afternoon, being a typical English village summer fete.
